_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. Executive Summary

This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:
- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program  Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5
- Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP)  Title 40 CFR §68
- California Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 8 CCR §5189
- Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 29 CFR §1910.119

Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM program.

This program is intended to be a living document. As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Swift Cold Storage, LLC has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities. 

1.1 Swift Cold Storage, LLC, Risk and Process Safety Management Program

This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Swift Cold Storage, LLC has updated their unified RMP-PSM Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following processes which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities: 

Process Name                       Process Chemical                  Process Quantity(lbs.)
Process 1 (East)                    Anhydrous Ammonia           26,000
Process 2 (West)                   Anhydrous Ammonia           28,000

Our RMP-PSM program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, illnesses, and physical property damage.

Our company has many policies and procedures in place to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. We have:

1. Prepared a unified program based on the PSM regulation to meet CalARP and RMP obligations as well
2. Organized the program so that it meshes closely with general business practices
3. Utilized PSMWriter software to ensure that all necessary employees have access to relevant information (SOPs, PHAs, audits, etc.)

The RMP-PSM program sets forth rules, procedures, and practices that will help our employees and neighbors protect themselves.

1.2 Process Descriptions

1.2.1 Facility Overview

Swift Cold Storage, LLC operates a commercial cold storage for bread and various other goods in Fresno, CA. The facility has two ammonia refrigeration systems that provide refrigeration capacity to the following:
P1 - East System
(14) Cold Storage Rooms
(1) Tray Pack Room

P2 - West System
(1) Loading Dock
(2) Freezers
(1) Receiving Dock
(1) Blast Cell Corridor
(12) Blast Cells
(1) Deslatting Room

1.2.2 Facility Location
Swift Cold Storage, LLC is located at 2950 East California Avenue, Fresno, CA 93721. The latitude and longitude of the largest high pressure receiver is 36.720673, -119.774579. The facility is located approximately 1/2 mile east of state highway 41 in an industrial area surrounded primarily by various businesses.

According to FEMA Flood Map Service, the facility is partly located in an area of minimal flood hazard and partly located in a special flood hazard area. The elevation of the machinery rooms were designed with the flood hazards in mind.

Swift Cold Storage, LLC is not located in an Alquist-Priolo Fault Zone as defined by the California Department of Conservation. In addition, a review of United States Geological Survey (USGS) fault maps revealed that there are no faults in close proximity to the site. The USGS 2018 One-Year Model revealed that Swift Cold Storage, LLC has a 1-2% chance of experiencing potentially minor-damage due to ground shaking in 2018.

The refrigerated areas are equipped with air-cool

ing evaporators which are supplied from a recirculator as required for pumped overfeed operation.

Most control valve groups are located on the roof to provide easy access. The refrigeration machinery is contained within or directly above the machinery room. A partial list of system components includes:

1.2.4 Process Classification

Each ammonia refrigeration system at Swift Cold Storage, LLC consists of vessels, equipment, and valves which are interconnected by piping. The systems are neither interconnected nor co-located relative to each other. As such, the refrigeration systems at Swift Cold Storage, LLC are treated as two (2) independent processes.

1.3 General Accident Release & Chemical Specific Prevention Steps

1.3.1 General 

We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in annual safety meetings. During these meetings we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.

Swift Cold Storage, LLC has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and alternative release scenarios for the ammonia refrigeration processes. These are for the purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in PSMWriter and hard copy binders. 

1.3.2 Anhydrous Ammonia

The ammonia refrigeration processes at the Swift Cold Storage, LLC facility is an integral part of the overall business and operates most of the year. The ammonia processes contain a total charge of approximately 54,000 LBS. It is extremely important that each process is maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia leak.

Our refrigeration personnel monitor the ammonia refrigeration processes and keep active records of all procedures and transactions that pertain to ammo

nia. In addition, the processes are checked frequently by one of the outside refrigeration contractors that we use. These contractors also assist in performing the annual mechanical integrity inspection of our ammonia equipment. 

1.4 Five Year Accident History

Swift Cold Storage, LLC has had no accidental release within the last five (5) years.

1.5 Emergency Action and Response Plan

Swift Cold Storage, LLCs emergency action and response program has been developed to satisfy the following requirements:
- Cal/OSHAs Emergency Action Plan  Title 8 CCR §3220
- U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administrations (OSHA) Emergency Action Plans  Title 29 CFR §1910.38
- Cal/OSHAs Process Safety Management [Emergency Response Program Requirements]  Title 8 CCR §5189(n)
- U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administrations (OSHA) Process Safety Management [Emergency Planning and Response Requirements]  Title 29 CFR §1910.119(n)
- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program [Emergency Response Program Requirements]  Title 19 CCR, Division 2, Chapter 4.5 §2765.1-2765.2
- USEPA Risk Management Program [Emergency Response Program Requirements]  Title 40 CFR §68.95
- California Hazardous Materials Business Plan (HMBP) [Emergency Response Plans and Procedures]  Title 19 CCR, Division 2, Chapter 4 §2731

Strategically, we will respond minimally to a release. Under this plan we will call emergency personnel and evacuate the facility. All response activities would be done in coordination with the Local Fire Department and their Hazardous Materials Response Team. 

Every year we review with our employees our evacuation procedures in the event of an emergency, including a hazardous chemical release.

1.6 Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Swift Cold Storage, LLC has implemented many policies and procedures to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. Nevertheless, Swift Cold Storage, LLC continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.

By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved Swift Cold Storage, LLCs ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that Swift Cold Storage, LLCs management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.

Swift Cold Storage, LLC has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.

In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, Swift Cold Storage, LLC has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help with RMP-PSM program implementation.

For the future, Swift Cold Storage, LLC now thinks of the RMP-PSM program as a living document. It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for Swift Cold Storage, LLC employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement. Through the RMP-PSM program Swift Cold Storage, LLC will continue to maintain overall plant worker and public safety.
